thread.title: Tom Brady thinks someone stole his Super Bowl LI game jersey
thread.title_full: Tom Brady thinks someone stole his Super Bowl LI game jersey

title: Tom Brady thinks someone stole his Super Bowl LI game jersey
text:
Despite becoming the first quarterback in NFL history to win five Super Bowls after directing the largest comeback in the illustrious championship’s history, Tom Brady still had at least one problem on Sunday night.
In the celebratory postgame locker room, Brady realized that he was unable to find his game jersey, which he had taken off after the Patriots’ clinched the team’s fifth Vince Lombardi Trophy.
“It was right here,” Brady reportedly said in the locker room as he called security to help look for the missing jersey. “I know exactly where I put it.”
Brady can also be heard telling Patriots owner Robert Kraft that he believed his jersey was stolen. Kraft simply quipped, “Well, we better look online.”
Here’s video of Brady’s exchange with Kraft:
Hey can someone give Tom Brady his jersey back? #SB51 (via @danhanzus ) pic.twitter.com/cv99qUW4XY
— NFL (@NFL) February 6, 2017
